title: What if Nullifying Orb was Adaptive?
body:
What if instead of only applying to magic damage, Nullifying Orb applied to the type of damage that pushed a champion below 30%?
Curious if anyone would like this idea. I'd like it more on certain champs I play (Rakan & Nunu, probably). Mostly I'd just like to see more physical-only shields, and this was the first idea I thought of.

If you've got another idea for a physical-only shield, I'd love to hear it.

There's two ways of doing this - first as you said, based off triggering damage.  The other way is how Camile's passive works, where the shield is based off what type of damage the triggering attack's champion does more of.  Option 1 allows enemies to work around it by procing it with alternate damage, but option 2 provides a more useful shield to the user.  (Note, option 2 does still allow enemies to work around the shield by having one player proc it, then other players move in with the alternate damage)

It would be very nice to get this rune a bit more oomph, it seems to be second rate in many cases.

I think this is a rune that could replace Overheal in Precision (Physical Shield). If it were in resolve it'd have to be in the same row as Shield Bash so that it wouldn't be abused easily.

I think it wouldn't fit very well into the Overheal slot, particularly because it would be competing with Triumph and PoM. The thematic doesn't fit very well into precision, either.
It wouldn't really be abused in the resolve tree either, because the shield itself isn't particularly strong, you can't control when you get it, and by the time you get it you're below 30% HP and probably aren't going to find the extra 20-40 damage on an auto attack all that useful. Plus it's on a 60 second cooldown. The rationale I would use for keeping it out of resolve is that they already get Bone Plating, and the shield is primarily used as a second chance for champs who build lots of AD and AP.

It'd become too general of a shield, and too effective against most things.

An option would be to base it either off of the user's damage type or the *inverse* of their damage type, if you wanted to open it up against AD, however.
So basicly you want to give Camille passive to everyone NO THANKS.
